principle: Fully automatic processes produce accessible content

guidelines.name: Generates accessible markup
guidelines.description: When the tool generates markup, that markup is accessible. If accesssibility information is required, like alternative texts, the content editor is prompted to provide that information.

guidelines.name: Preserves accessibility information
guidelines.description: If content is pasted from a word processor or converted from one format into another, any accessibility information is preserved.

guidelines.name: Accessible content production is possible
guidelines.description: If some options produce more accessible content than others, they are displayed more prominently. If properties and attributes can be set, those relevant for accessibility can also be set.

guidelines.name: Editors guided
guidelines.description: Editors are guided to produce accessible content.

guidelines.name: Text alternatives can be managed
guidelines.description: There is a tool for providing text alternatives to “non-text content”, like images, videos and data visualisation.

guidelines.name: Accessible templates available
guidelines.description: There are accessible templates available. If there is a repository of templates, it is easy to find the ones that prioritise accessibility.

guidelines.name: Accessible components/plug-ins available
guidelines.description: If any components or plugins are built-in to the tool, they are accessible. If there is a gallery of components or plug-ins, it indicates accessible options.

principle: Helps with improving the accessibility of existing content

guidelines.name: Checks accessibility automatically
guidelines.description: Has built-in checks for common accessibility problems, for example a check to identify missing alternative text.

guidelines.name: Helps content editors fix problems
guidelines.description: Provides suggestions to content editor about accessibility problems.

guidelines.name: Accessibility features prominent
guidelines.description: Accessibility features are on by default and a prominent part of the editing workflow. Documentation shows examples of how to create accessible content, for instance with example markup or screenshots.

guidelines.name: Documentation promotes accessibility
guidelines.description: Provides suggestions to content editor about accessibility problems.
